headline: Assessing Delta Air Lines (DAL) Valuation After Recent Share Price Moves And Conflicting Fair Value Views
summary: Why Delta Air Lines (DAL) Is Back on Many Investors’ Radar Delta Air Lines (DAL) has drawn fresh attention after recent share price moves, with the stock slipping about 1.5% over the past day but showing a gain over the past 3 months. See our latest analysis for Delta Air Lines. For context, Delta’s share price has seen an 18.51% gain over the past 90 days after a 3.38% decline over 30 days. The 3 year total shareholder return of 83.87% points to a very strong longer term outcome relative to...

headline: Is Delta Air Lines (DAL) Pricing Reflect Long Term Travel Demand And Cash Flow Outlook
summary: If you are wondering whether Delta Air Lines at around US$69.78 is offering you good value right now, it helps to step back and look at what the current price is actually baking in. The stock has returned 4.9% over the last 7 days, while the 30 day return is a 3.4% decline, with gains of 1.0% year to date, 4.0% over 1 year, 83.9% over 3 years and 67.9% over 5 years shaping how the market currently views its potential and risks. Recent coverage of Delta has focused on how the airline fits...

headline: ‘Dow Theory’ Sends a Buy Signal as Transportation Stocks Rally
summary: Moves in transportation shares suggest the rally in stocks can continue even though the market has been slammed.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average, up by nearly 2% to a record intraday high, led the way.  For those who believe in Dow Theory, the notion that a simultaneous record run in the transports and the broader average is great news for the overall market, this is an encouraging sign.
